sn2.20:1.1: Standing to one side, the young deva Anāthapiṇḍika recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn2.20:2.2: The resort of the Order of seers,
sn2.20:2.3: Dwelt in by the Dhamma King,
sn2.20:2.4: A place that gives me joy.
sn2.20:4.2: Out of regard for his own good,
sn2.20:4.4: Thus he is purified in it.
sn2.20:5.2: With virtue and with inner peace.
sn2.20:5.3: Even a bhikkhu who has gone beyond
sn2.20:5.4: At best can only equal him. ”
sn2.20:6.1: This is what the young deva Anāthapiṇḍika said.
sn2.20:6.2: Having said this, he paid homage to the Blessed One and, keeping him on the right, he disappeared right there.
sn2.20:7.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:
sn2.20:7.2: “Bhikkhus, last night, when the night had advanced, a certain young deva … approached me …
sn2.20:7.3: and in my presence recited these verses:
sn2.20:11.4: At best can only equal him.
sn2.20:12.1: ’“This is what that young deva said.
sn2.20:12.2: Having said this, he paid homage to me and, keeping me on the right, he disappeared right there.
sn2.20:13.1: When this was said, the Venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One:
sn2.20:13.2: “Venerable sir, that young deva must surely have been Anāthapiṇḍika.
sn2.20:13.3: For Anāthapiṇḍika the householder had full confidence in the Venerable Sāriputta. ”
sn2.20:13.4: “Good, good, Ānanda! You have drawn the right inference by reasoning.
sn2.20:13.5: For that young deva, Ānanda, was Anāthapiṇḍika. ”
